snippet: Louis C. Taylor was convicted for starting the deadliest fire in Arizona history, but his case is now helping to call into question previously held arson investigation principles.
abstract: Louis C Taylor is released from prison 42 years after being convicted of arson in Arizona hotel fire that claimed 29 lives; several cases like Taylor's are being re-examined as scientists debunk techniques that have long been used to determine proof of arson.
lead_paragraph: Louis C. Taylor was convicted for starting the deadliest fire in Arizona history, but his case is now helping to call into question previously held arson investigation principles.

headline.main: Advances in Science of Fire Free a Convict After 42 Years
